Threat Description: Attackers can manipulate data in the application using the database, due to improper access controls or vulnerabilities in the application.
Countermeasure: Implement proper access controls and encryption for sensitive data, and regularly update the application with the latest security patches.
ASVS Reference: OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) - Data Validation and Encryption
SANS Reference: SANS Institute - Securing Web Applications: Best Practices and Strategies
CIS Reference: Center for Internet Security (CIS) - Web Application Security Best Practices
MITRE Tactics Description: Attackers can manipulate data in the application using the database, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
MITRE Techniques Description: Attackers can use data encoding techniques to obfuscate malicious data in the application, making it difficult to detect and prevent attacks.

Threat Description: Attackers can inject malicious commands into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent attackers from injecting malicious commands.
ASVS Reference: OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) - Input Validation and Sanitization
SANS Reference: SANS Institute - Securing Web Applications: Best Practices and Strategies
CIS Reference: Center for Internet Security (CIS) - Web Application Security Best Practices
MITRE Tactics Description: Attackers can inject malicious commands into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
MITRE Techniques Description: Attackers can use command encoding techniques to obfuscate malicious commands in the application, making it difficult to detect and prevent attacks.

Threat Description: Attackers can inject malicious SQL code into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent attackers from injecting malicious SQL code.
ASVS Reference: OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) - Input Validation and Sanitization
SANS Reference: SANS Institute - Securing Web Applications: Best Practices and Strategies
CIS Reference: Center for Internet Security (CIS) - Web Application Security Best Practices
MITRE Tactics Description: Attackers can inject malicious SQL code into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
MITRE Techniques Description: Attackers can use SQL injection techniques to manipulate the application's database, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.

Threat Description: Attackers can inject malicious scripts into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
Countermeasure: Implement proper input validation and sanitization mechanisms to prevent attackers from injecting malicious scripts.
ASVS Reference: OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) - Input Validation and Sanitization
SANS Reference: SANS Institute - Securing Web Applications: Best Practices and Strategies
CIS Reference: Center for Internet Security (CIS) - Web Application Security Best Practices
MITRE Tactics Description: Attackers can inject malicious scripts into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
MITRE Techniques Description: Attackers can use cross-site scripting techniques to inject malicious scripts into the application, leading to unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.

Threat Description: Attackers can flood the application with malicious traffic, leading to a denial of service and potential unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
Countermeasure: Implement proper rate limiting and traffic filtering mechanisms to prevent attackers from flooding the application with malicious traffic.
ASVS Reference: OWASP Application Security Verification Standard (ASVS) - Rate Limiting and Traffic Filtering
OWASP Reference: OWASP Top 10 - A4: Broken Access Control
SANS Reference: SANS Institute - Securing Web Applications: Best Practices and Strategies
CIS Reference: Center for Internet Security (CIS) - Web Application Security Best Practices
MITRE Tactics Description: Attackers can flood the application with malicious traffic, leading to a denial of service and potential unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
MITRE Techniques Description: Attackers can use traffic flooding techniques to overwhelm the application with malicious traffic, leading to a denial of service and potential unauthorized access or disclosure of sensitive information.
